WBI Investments Inc. Acquires 20,374 Shares of B&G Foods, Inc. (NYSE:BGS)Posted by ABMN Staff on Oct 12th, 2021...WBI Investments Inc. grew its holdings in B&G Foods, Inc. (NYSE:BGS) by 57.1% in the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent disclosure with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The firm owned 56,073 shares of the company’s stock after acquiring an additional 20,374 shares during the quarter. WBI Investments Inc. owned 0.09% of B&G Foods worth $1,839,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

While people may call this a boring stock it is reacting to the market as expected. It is a defensive stock which should hold steady and pays a nice dividend. Since we have entered into a normal volatile period BGS is the place to be.

So, the question is, “is food a commodity or a consumer staple with regards to sector”? I say food is delicious and we all want and need it. Let them short the stock and starve!

Looking for 31.25 -31.40 by Tuesday. BGS our solid stock investment.

If you are on the side of thinking that we will need 90% vaccinated for herd immunity we are a long ways from getting there. The R0 of the delta variant is so much higher than the original virus causing this 90% hurdle. This is a real downer because 90% seems like an insurmountable mountain to climb with so many skeptics on getting vaccinated. From an investment standpoint BGS will continue to prosper under a eat-at-home environment for awhile.
Impressive move today especially since it is an ex-dividend day. It is basically proving to be a solid defensive stock K and KHC in green too
Increase in snap benefits of 27% starting in October, should see a good bump in revenue from that.
Food stocks will be fine. BGS is still looking good. Pre divy 30.50? No problem.

$503.00 Million in Sales Expected for B&G Foods, Inc. (NYSE:BGS) This QuarterPosted by ABMN Staff on Sep 17th, 2021Equities research analysts forecast that B&G Foods, Inc. (NYSE:BGS) will announce $503.00 million in sales for the current quarter, according to Zacks Investment Research. Three analysts have issued estimates for B&G Foods’ earnings, with the lowest sales estimate coming in at $485.20 million and the highest estimate coming in at $520.80 million. B&G Foods posted sales of $495.76 million during the same quarter last year, which indicates a positive year over year growth rate of 1.5%. The firm is expected to issue its next earnings results on Thursday, November 4th.On average, analysts expect that B&G Foods will report full year sales of $2.06 billion for the current fiscal year, with estimates ranging from $2.04 billion to $2.08 billion. For the next fiscal year, analysts forecast that the firm will post sales of $2.09 billion, with estimates ranging from $2.07 billion to $2.10 billion. Zacks’ sales calculations are a mean average based on a survey of research analysts that follow B&G Foods
